meanings.definition: Having wings shed or cast off
meanings.sent1: The dealate butterfly fluttered gracefully in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The dealate bird soared high in the sky after shedding its wings.
meanings.sent3: The dealate dragonfly decided it was time for a wingless vacation.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams took flight like a dealate bird, shedding all constraints.
meanings.sent5: The dealate insect looked majestic as it glided through the air, free from its wings.

meanings.sent1: The butterfly will dealate after its final metamorphosis.
meanings.sent2: Birds dealate during molting season to grow new feathers.
meanings.sent3: The dragonfly dealated gracefully, bidding farewell to its wings.
meanings.sent4: As the plane landed, it seemed to dealate slowly before coming to a stop.
meanings.sent5: The superhero had to dealate in order to enter the secret lair undetected.

meanings.sent1: The dealate scorpion scurried across the desert floor.
meanings.sent2: In the jar, the dealate beetle crawled without its wings.
meanings.sent3: The dealate ant organized a wingless parade in the anthill.
meanings.sent4: The dealate moth fluttered clumsily, missing its wings' support.
meanings.sent5: Children marveled at the dealate grasshopper, hopping effortlessly without wings.
